data.title: No SRK or Aamir, Marathi-cinema rich in content: Sumeet Raghavan
data.text:
Bollywood hotshots shifting focus to Marathi cinema: Sumeet

Raghavan added that Bollywood bigwigs are shifting their focus to Marathi cinema, which is a huge thing for the regional film industry. Citing the example of Priyanka Chopra's "Ventilator", he said, "The film did not have a star, but the content was terrific." The actor has also acted in Bollywood films such as "U Me Aur Hum", "Firraq", Akshay Kumar-starrer "Holiday" among others.

Picky and choosy about my work: Sumeet

Raghavan said that although he is offered a lot of projects both on television and in films, he doesn't give his nod until he finds something interesting. "There are a lot of factors for me to do a film. I have been very picky and choosy about my work. I have stayed away from monotony or sub-standard work" he added.

Madhuri's Marathi debut film 'Bucket List'
